articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Cambodian Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Cambodian Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday met and had a talk with a delegation of Economic, Social and Cultural Council of the Council of Ministers of Cambodia headed by Yim Nolla, senior minister of Cambodia, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					 The traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by Great King Samdech Norodom Sihanouk and Generalissimo Kim Il Sung are noble, said the head of the Cambodian delegation.
					
					 He paid high tribute to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The government and people of the DPRK have extended full support and solidarity to the Cambodian people in the just struggle, he added.
					
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, he sincerely wished the dear respected Kim Jong Un would wisely lead the Korean people's struggle for achieving prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of South Sudan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of South Sudan 
 Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Salva Kiir Mayardit, president of the Republic of South Sudan, on the first anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message wished him greater success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 He expressed his conviction that the friendly relations between the two countries would favorably develop in line with the desire and wishes of their peoples.

articles.title: Cambodian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Cambodian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Economic, Social and Cultural Council of the Council of Ministers of Cambodia headed by Yim Nolla, a senior minister, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The guests looked round the historic relics, being briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and his family members.
					
					 They then went round the revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 After wrapping up his visit, the head of the delegation said:
					
					 Generalissimo Kim Il Sung made the 250-mile journey in his early years to learn about Korea.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is the founding father of socialist Korea.
					
					The delegation also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, Arch of Triumph, Mansudae Art Studio and other places.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Academy of Social Sciences headed by its Vice-President Ji Sung Chol left here by airplane on Monday to visit China.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Cambodian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Cambodian Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from the visiting delegation of Economic, Social and Cultural Council of the Council of Ministers of Cambodia.
					 The gift was handed over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday by Yim Nolla, senior minister of Cambodia.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful at Asian Juvenile Wrestling Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful at Asian Junior Wrestling Championship
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestlers proved successful at the 2012 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship in Kyrgyzstan.
					 Kim Han Song won a gold medal in 42kg category of men's free style wrestling while Kim Hyon Gyong and Jong In Sun bagged gold medals in 43kg and 52kg categories of women's wrestling.
					
					 Ri Jin Ok placed second in 49kg category of women's wrestling.
					
					 Bronze medals went to Kim Pyong Ju in 50kg category of men's freestyle wrestling, Son Kwon Hui in 42kg category of Greco-roman wrestling and Ryang Sun Gyong in 46kg category of women's wrestling.

articles.title: Ogasan Botanical Exhibition Built
articles.content:
Ogasan Botanical Exhibition Built 
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The Ogasan Botanical Exhibition was newly built in Hwaphyong County, Jagang Province in the DPRK.
					 There is a semi-panorama showing natural virgin forests in Mt. Oga in the peculiarly built exhibition. 
					
					 On display on either side of the semi-panorama are more than a thousand botanical specimens of Mt. Oga and more than 100 specimens of seeds. 
					
					 There is around the exhibition an arboretum covering three hectares where there grow thousands of trees of over 120 species which originate from places at different sea levels in Mt. Oga. 
					
					 There is a map showing the distribution of trees in the nature conservation area of Mt. Oga to the convenience of visitors. 
					
					 The exhibition helps visitors easily acquire rich knowledge about the nature of Mt. Oga area without touring the whole area of the nature conservation area.
					
					 Mt. Oga, located in the northwestern part of Korea, is a famous mountain rich in natural virgin forests, fauna and flora.

articles.title: DPRK People Indignant at Ro's Arrest
articles.content:
DPRK People Indignant at Ro's Arrest
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for Korea's Reunification, Ro Su Hui, was forcibly taken away by agents of the south Korean Ministry of Unification and Intelligence Agency as soon as he crossed the Demarcation Line in Panmunjom. He had visited Pyongyang to mourn the death of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The arrest enrages the people in the north of Korea.
					
					 Ryang Mun Chol, a worker at the Chollima Steel Complex, told KCNA:
					
					 "When I saw on TV south Korean agents treating Ro Su Hui like a package, I was inflamed with animosity against the group of fascists.
					
					 No matter how desperately the Lee Myung Bak regime may try, it can never dampen south Koreans' reverence for the father of the nation."
					
					 Ko Myong Ae, a farmer of the Naewoe Co-op Farm in Hwangju County, North Hwanghae Province, said:
					
					 "The Lee group of traitors handcuffed and tied Ro Su Hui who should have been praised for his righteous deed for national reunification.
					
					 The traitors are like cursed dogs as they bars south Koreans from visiting the DPRK where fellow countrymen live while frequenting the United States.
					
					 Korea can never be in peace with the rabid dogs left unremoved, so the enemies to the nation should be removed at once."
					
					 Won Kwang Yon, a student at Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, said:
					
					 "The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors egged riff-raffs on to hold a 'protest rally'. The traitors, engaged in committing such hideous provocations, will be bound to face a stern punishment by history."

articles.title: "Jiwon" (Aim High), Kim Hyong Jik's Lifelong Motto
articles.content:
"Jiwon" (Aim High), Kim Hyong Jik's Lifelong Motto
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A hanging-roll bearing letters "Jiwon" (Aim High) can be found in any house of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					  "Jiwon" represents the revolutionary view of life that man should find pride and happiness in the efforts for the country and the nation. 
					
					 This idea of "Jiwon" was advanced by Kim Hyong Jik, outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, who was born into a poor peasant family in Mangyongdae on July 10, 1894.
					
					  Regarding the idea as his lifelong motto, he had conducted the education in patriotism among the broad sections of people and encouraged them to the anti-Japanese struggle. 
					
					 On March 23, Juche 6 (1917) he formed the Korean National Association, an anti-Japanese underground revolutionary organization largest-ever in scale and most steadfast in the stand for independence against imperialism at that time.
					
					 On the basis of analysis into the changed situation at home and abroad and the lesson taught by the March First Popular Uprising, he convened the Chongsudong Meeting and the Kuandian Meeting to set forth a policy of changing the course of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea from the nationalist movement to the proletarian revolution.
					
					 He had worked heart and soul only for the independence of the country from the start of his revolutionary activity to the last moments of his life.
					
					Indeed, his was the glorious life of a great pioneer who dedicated himself to exploring the road of national liberation with the idea of "Jiwon". 
					
					 Kim Hyong Jik trained the members of the Mangyongdae family to be great revolutionaries and patriots and led young Kim Il Sung, his son, to the road of the revolution. He left the idea of "Jiwon", the idea on preparedness for three contingencies and gaining comrades and two pistols to the son as a valuable legacy.
					
					 His great feats are still kept in the mind of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Deeply Respected by Vietnamese People
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Deeply Respected by Vietnamese People
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- In his lifetime President Kim Il Sung won high admiration and deep trust from heads of state and people in many countries for his greatness in idea, leadership art and personality as well as for the feats performed for the times and revolution.
					 Among them were Ho Chi Minh and people of Vietnam. "Comrade Kim Il Sung is the great leader representing the 20th century." This is what Ho Chi Minh said from the bottom of his heart after meeting with the President.
					
					 Ho Chi Minh's admiration for Kim Il Sung was exceptional.
					
					 It was in July Juche 46 (1957) that he met with Kim Il Sung in Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Il Sung spent hours with Ho, sharing views on a series of matters and introducing the experience the DPRK gained in building a new society.
					
					 Before return home, Ho said it was regretful for him to have met Kim Il Sung so late.
					
					 "I have acquired a lot of things during my three-day visit to the DPRK, which are too many to get in three years. I want to stay longer here to learn more from Comrade Kim Il Sung," he added.
					
					 Reverence of Ho and his people for Kim Il Sung grew stronger in November 1958 when the latter visited Hanoi.
					
					 A rally was held in a square in Hanoi on Nov. 28 in celebration of his visit to Vietnam. As Kim Il Sung concluded his speech there, the presider was going to the speaker's table to declare the close of the meeting.
					
					 Just at that time, Ho Chi Minh spoke to the crowd that Kim Il Sung was a peerless hero who defeated two imperialisms for the first time in the East and an outstanding leader in building a new society. And he suggested chanting hurrah to express thanks to Kim Il Sung for implanting the spirit of Chollima (legendary horse running 400 kilometers a day) into the Vietnamese people. In a moment, the crowd burst into cheers of hurrah, led by Ho.
					
					 The scene provided a glimpse of deep reverence of Ho and his people for Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: U.S. Can Not Avoid Responsibility for Increasing Tension of Korean Peninsula: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Can Not Avoid Responsibility for Increasing Tension on Korean Peninsula: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The United States is running the whole gamut of trickery to evade its responsibility for aggravating the situation of the Korean Peninsula.
					 The U.S. Department of State called the recent U.S.-south Korea joint military drills "annual exercises for defence", claiming it has no willingness to be hostile toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. claim is preposterous as the joint military maneuvers are aimed at the DPRK, beyond the nature of annual exercises.
					
					 The offensive and aggressive nature of what the U.S. called annual exercises can be proved by a military drill it kicked off against the DPRK with June 25, the day when it ignited a war against the DPRK, as an occasion.
					
					 The drill included a joint naval mobile training, a live-shell firing drill with south Korean forces, with nuclear-powered carrier George Washington and huge weaponry involved.
					
					 The drill was an actual war maneuver aimed at mounting a preemptive strike on the DPRK from the sea, the ground and the air. 
					
					 The U.S. called the maneuvers regular ones for "beating back and punishing" someone's "infiltration and provocation". But such method can never work today.
					
					 The purpose of the saber-rattling is to get on the nerves of the DPRK to make a military counteraction, which will be used as a pretext for igniting a war against it.
					
					 After occupying the DPRK by force of arms, the U.S. seeks to turn the Korean Peninsula into a strategic bridgehead and realize its ambition for world hegemony with ease.
					
					 Herein lie the purposes of the U.S.-led joint military exercises and reinforcement of armed forces in the Korean Peninsula and its vicinity.
					
					 The U.S. reckless military moves are laying a stumbling block in solving issues including one for ensuring the peace of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The U.S. has claimed so far that it has no willingness to invade the DPRK and be hostile to it. But the situation proves its claim was a sheer lie.
					
					 It is not accidental that Voice of Russia recently said the alleged threat to peace from the DPRK does not hold water when comparing actual strength between the DPRK and the U.S. and between the DPRK and south Korea.
					
					 No matter what wicked trickery the U.S. applies, it can not evade the responsibility for increasing the tension on the Korean Peninsula with threats and provocations.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces Lee Myung Bak Group for Suppressing Pro-reunification Figure
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces Lee Myung Bak Regime for Suppressing Pro-reunification Figure 
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The true colors of the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea as brutes have been laid bare in the world's eyes again. 
					 Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), visited Pyongyang to express deep condolences over the big loss to the nation.
					
					 As soon as he crossed the demarcation line in Panmunjom to go back to south Korea, agents pounced upon him like a pack of wolves and threw him behind bars. This was a hideous fascist action. 
					
					 The group of traitors hurled such wicked and mean human scum as those of the "alliance of the elders" into such reckless ruckus as hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 It was a reckless action of immoral hooligans absolutely unimaginable in the sense of sound human reason and thinking and open political provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 Ro's Pyongyang visit was a patriotic deed which fully represented the noble spirit of south Koreans who boundlessly revere General Secretary Kim Jong Il, a peerlessly great man. 
					
					 His visit deserves praise by all Koreans in view of the traditional beautiful manners and customs of the Korean nation and the spirit of national reconciliation and unity. Therefore, this can never be a crime. 
					
					 It is none other than the group of worst criminals that deserves punishment by history because it leveled guns at the fellow countrymen mourning over the big loss to the nation and barred south Koreans from paying condolatory visits to Pyongyang. 
					
					 Can one find anywhere else in the world such pro-U.S. lackeys and immoral guys bereft of even an iota of national conscience and sense of obligation as the Lee group? 
					
					 It is a bitter shame on the Korean nation that such illiterate and savage beasts are allowed to stay on this land in human skin.  
					
					 The Lee group is getting more frantic in its rackets to escalate the north-south confrontation and the campaign for "eliminating the forces following the north" with the suppression of Ro Su Hui as a momentum. This is the last-ditch efforts of a politician more dead than alive to prolong his remaining days. 
					
					 The Lee group sold off the interests of the nation while frequenting the U.S. Such traitor is trying hard to punish the pro-reunification patriotic forces. This is nothing but a blatant challenge to the dignity of the nation and sacred cause of national reunification.
					
					 The service personnel and people in the DPRK are fully determined to wipe out the cruel fascist tyrants to the last one.
					
					 The days of the Lee group are numbered.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Lashes Out at Lee Myung Bak Group's Treachery and Inhumanity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Lashes Out at Lee Myung Bak Group's Treachery and Inhumanity
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of south Korean perpetrated fascist suppression of Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), at Panmunjom. This was traitorous and inhuman acts of rubbing salt into wounds of all Koreans who are suffering from national division.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 This suppression was not just aimed to arrest Ro but it was a premeditated and deliberate provocation to kick off the racket to escalate confrontation with the DPRK and the whirlwind of fascist suppression, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The unethical act of the Lee group gave the lie to the "human rights", "freedom" and "democracy" which it has so far asserted.
					
					  It is none other than the Lee group which pushed the inter-Korean relations to the lowest ebb through unprecedented rackets of escalating confrontation with the DPRK and committing hideous provocations and became desperate to sever the kinship among Koreans, not content with blocking visits, contacts and cooperation projects between them.
					
					 The Lee group pricked its own eyes.
					
					 Traitor Lee Myung Bak, forsaken by the south Koreans, is making desperate efforts to find a way out in escalating confrontation with the DPRK and kicking up fascist suppression. This will get it nowhere.
					
					 History and nation will never pardon the group of traitors for its indelible treason against the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules U.S. "Human Rights" Assertion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules U.S. "Human Rights" Assertion
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Recently, ex-President of the U.S. Jimmy Carter contributed an article to the New York Times saying  the U.S. has no right to style itself the world's "human rights justice". 
					 Earlier this year a professor of George Washington University said that human rights abuses exceeded the normal standard in the U.S. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday runs a bylined commentary in this regard.
					
					 The U.S. is not in a position to admonish other countries as regards the human rights issue, the paper says.
					
					 Citing facts to prove the U.S. is the worst human rights abuser in the world, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. often kicks off rows over the human rights issue in the international arena and politicizes it, building up public opinion to internationalize it and put pressure on other countries. This reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The U.S. government authorities pull up the DPRK over the "human rights issue" whenever an opportunity is given. This does not deserve even a passing note as it is an unreasonable assertion like putting the cart before the horse. 
					
					 Human rights that are neither guaranteed by sovereignty nor can be defended by oneself are little different from the "human rights" of slaves. 
					
					 Protecting sovereignty precisely means to protect human rights under the present international situation where arbitrariness and unilateralism prevail and the jungle law governs. 
					
					 Steadfast is the principled stand of the DPRK to counter the U.S. reactionary human rights offensive with the revolutionary one. It is as foolish an act as trying to eclipse the sun with palm that the U.S. is trying to oppress the DPRK with the "human rights" offensive. 
					
					 The U.S., the tundra of human rights and architect of man-killing, would be well advised to mind its own business before talking about other's "human rights issue".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Inequality of SOFA
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Inequality of SOFA
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday carries a bylined article on the lapse of 46 years since the fabrication of the humiliating and treacherous south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" (SOFA), a slavery document of modern version.
					 The "agreement" brought the south Korean people unbearable hardship, misery and disgrace for nearly half a century, the article says, laying bare the inequality of the "agreement".
					
					 SOFA is a document that legitimized the privileged position of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The "agreement" deals with criminal jurisdiction, the issue of using land and facilities, taxes and immigration over the U.S. forces in south Korea. Every item of the agreement, however, grants the U.S. forces unilateral rights. 
					
					 SOFA made the GIs an "emperor" in south Korea and turned the land into a theatre of their crimes. 
					
					 The conclusion of the treacherous agreement fostered GIs' crimes in south Korea, far from eradication. Their means and methods baffled human imagination.
					
					 There happened murder, plunder and lots of other crimes by the GIs in south Korea so far. Tragic is that there were the dead and victims but no killers and assailants. The U.S. forces to be posted abroad regard south Korea as an "ideal military service place". This is entirely attributable to SOFA.
					
					 The "agreement" which brings disgrace to the south Korean people is an inevitable product of the U.S. policy of military presence in south Korea.
					
					 Prerequisite to ending the misfortune and disgraceful history and achieving the country's reunification by the Korean nation itself is to withdraw the GIs from south Korea and depose sycophantic traitors from office.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams U.S. Anti-Ballistic Missile Test
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams U.S. Anti-Ballistic Missile Test
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is trying to convince the public that its test of anti-ballistic missile in Hawaii on June 26 was aimed at coping with missile "threats" from the DPRK and Iran. This is intended to justify its moves to beef up armed forces and modernize military hardware.
					 Minju Joson Monday says in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is the U.S. intentions to realize its military attempt to stifle independent countries against imperialism like the DPRK at any cost by crippling their military capacity for self-defence and holding an unchallenged edge in the field of military hardware. It is also contemplating dragging countries strong in anti-imperialist and independent stand, strategic competitors and potential rivals into an arms race in an effort to curb their socio-economic development.
					
					 This clearly proves that the U.S. is, indeed, a warmonger and confrontational maniac threatening the global peace and security and reaction of history deterring mankind from making independent development.
					
					 The U.S. has resorted to its criminal moves to certainly stifle those countries holding aloft the banner of independence against imperialism and worked hard to cover up its black-minded nature, a ridiculous and reckless act.
					
					 It is nothing but a pipedream for the U.S. to try to pull up the DPRK with its confrontational policy of strength. The more the U.S. intensifies its hostile policy toward the DPRK, the further the DPRK will bolster its war deterrent for self-defence.
					
					 The U.S. should immediately give up its anachronistic moves to stifle the DPRK, facing up to the DPRK's enmity against the U.S.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Emerge Military Giant under Fire by S. Korean Broadcasting Service
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Emerge Military Giant under Fire by S. Korean Broadcasting Service 
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation (MBC) of south Korea said in a program on Japan's moves to become a military giant:
					 Japan is showing a sign of claiming the right to collective self-defence in the wake of its call for nuclear weaponization.
					
					 There are evident moves of Japan to emerge a military giant with its way being paved for mounting a preemptive attack on other countries.
					
					 A committee under the prime minister which has studied a medium-and long-term prospect presented a report calling for the approval of the exercise of the right to collective self-defence.
					
					 The right to collective self-defence means the right to counter an invasion of an ally by other country, considering it as aggression against Japan. This means an action is not confined to the defence of its country but allows intervention in international dispute and even preemptive attack on others in some cases.
					
					  Since its defeat in World War II, Japan has kept the "Self-Defence Forces" as a conception of passive defence of the homeland, subject to the Constitution that prohibits the possession of an army.
					
					 The right to collective self-defence may make a fundamental switchover.
					
					 The biggest opposition Liberal Democratic Party has already committed itself to claiming not only the right to collective self-defence but replacing the "SDF" by "National Defence Forces."
					
					 The ruling Democratic Party is likely to stage a conservative campaign with the approach of the general election and support for the right to collective self-defence is strong in the political camp of Japan including Prime Minister Noda.
					
					 What is noteworthy is the U.S. friendly approach toward this issue within the framework of the U.S.-Japan military cooperation.
					
					 Japan has been persistent in its moves to become a military giant ranging from the permission of arms export, argument about nuclear weaponization, promotion of the conclusion of the General Security of Military Information Agreement to the right to collective self-defence.

articles.title: Japan's Wild Ambition to Stage Comeback to Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Wild Ambition to Stage Comeback to Korea under Fire
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- 33 civic and public organizations of south Korea, including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Solidarity for Progress, held a press conference in Seoul on July 6 and denounced Japan for its undisguised ambition for reinvasion.
					 The press release read out at the conference recalled that shortly ago, Japan issued a report which called for allowing its "Self-Defence Forces" to exercise the "right to collective self-defence".
					
					 This suggests that Japan's moves to revive militarism have reached a full-scale phase as part of the scenario of its ultra-right forces to turn it into a military giant, it said, adding:
					
					 Lurking behind those moves of Japan is the U.S. attempt for aggression to maintain and boost its unchallenged military position in Asia.
					
					 The press release slammed the shameless attitude of Japan dreaming of the revival of militarism, far from repenting of its colonial rule under which it imposed unbearable pain and sufferings upon the Korean nation and the historic errors it committed as a war criminal state.
					
					 It demanded Japan immediately roll back its confrontational military policy including the SDF's exercise of the "right to collective self-defence" which escalates military tension and conflict on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Hurl Vice-Chairman of Pomminryon S. HQ behind Bar
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Hurl Vice-Chairman of Pomminryon S. HQ behind Bar
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean security authorities detained Ro So Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), on charge of the violation of the "Security Law", according to south Korean KBS Sunday.
					 The Seoul Central District Court issued a warrant of arrest for Ro, charging that his acts of expressing condolences over the great loss to the nation and visit to the Tower of the Juche Idea and the Arch of Triumph were "pro-north activities" and violation of SL.
					
					 It is reported that Ro is strongly opposed to the puppet authorities' suppression, saying he visited the north out of his desire for reunification.
					
					 The fascist suppression of the pro-reunification activist is bound to meet punishment of history as it is treason against reunification, a blatant challenge to the desire and wish of all Koreans for national unity and reunification.

articles.title: Actions for Frustrating Anti-Reunification Moves of Group of Traitors in S. Korea Called for
articles.content:
Actions for Frustrating Anti-Reunification Moves of Group of Traitors in S. Korea Called for 
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The Japan regional committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration made public a special statement on July 6 on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the publication of the July 4 Joint Statement. 
					 The special statement said that four decades have passed since the Koreans were greatly excited to receive the first programme for reunification common to the nation. 
					
					 It accused the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea of bringing the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse and frantically kicking up the racket for confrontation with fellow countrymen in collusion with outside forces in denial of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for reunification common to the nation in the new century which embodied the three principles for national reunification. 
					
					 It also blasted the south Korean "government" authorities for committing thrice-cursed treachery intended to pave the way for Japan's reinvasion, while working hard to conclude a military agreement with Japan.
					
					 The statement condemned the south Korean authorities for becoming more desperate in their moves to intensify the suppression of the pro-reunification patriotic organizations with the return of the vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification to south Korea as a momentum. 
					
					 The June 15 Japan regional committee bitterly denounces the traitorous anti-reunification action taken by the Lee Myung Bak regime for frantically pursuing sycophancy and treachery and confrontation with fellow countrymen in a bid  to prolong its remaining days and stay in power. 
					
					 History clearly shows how miserable the fates of the traitors were, it noted, demanding the present ruling quarters of south Korea make an apology for the crimes against the country and the nation and immediately step down. 
					
					 The statement called upon all Koreans in the north, the south and abroad to achieve strong solidarity and alliance and turn out in a nationwide struggle to frustrate the anti-reunification moves of the sycophantic and traitorous forces and open up a new phase of independent reunification.

articles.title: Overseas Korean Organizations Slam Lee Myung Bak Regime for Its Fascist Suppression
articles.content:
Overseas Korean Organizations Slam Lee Myung Bak Regime for Its Fascist Suppression
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia made public a statement on Sunday to denounce the south Korean regime for suppressing Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), and its provocations against the DPRK.
					 The statement recalled that the Lee Myung Bak regime brutally suppressed Ro Su Hui, who returned to south Korea after visiting Pyongyang to express condolences over the great loss to the nation.
					
					 The Koreans in Russia can hardly repress their resentment against the regime, which set in motion ultra-right conservative groups to dare hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, timed to coincide with the suppression, it said, and continued:
					
					 Ro's visit to express condolences over the great loss to the Korean nation as its member was very just and heroic deed which deserves appraisal in the light of ethics, morality and beautiful manners and customs of the Korean people handed down through generations and in view of national reconciliation and unity.
					
					 The group of traitors is a band of unethical and immoral hooligans as they pounced on Ro crossing the demarcation line of Panmunjom like a pack of wolves and took him away like an animal.
					
					 The Association bitterly condemns the brutal atrocities of the traitors, demanding them to stop at once the suppression of pro-reunification figures including Ro and the racket to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen and immediately set them free.
					
					 The Commonwealth of Independent States Regional Headquarters of Pomminryon also released a statement on Saturday in denunciation of the south Korean regime's fascist suppression of Ro Su Hui and their racket to escalate confrontation with compatriots.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korea's Provocative War Drill under Fire
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korean War Drill under Fire
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Han Kil Su, director of the Information Department of the General Association of Koreans in China, made public a statement on June 26 in denunciation of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet regime for their frantic moves to ignite a war against the DPRK.
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea and the south Korean warmongers staged the largest-ever live-shell firing drill in the area south of the demilitarized zone on June 22, the statement said, and continued:
					
					 Live-shell firing at the flag of a sovereign state is an extremely grave provocation.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is finding itself in the worst crisis, hit hard from all sides. It is now working hard to escalate confrontation and ignite a war, taking advantage of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The Lee group is the top class war servant and nuclear war accomplice of the U.S. as it cries "it would not rule out a war" in collusion with its American master, utterly indifferent to the country, nation and the destiny of Koreans.
					
					 How can Koreans live under the same sky with this group of traitors getting so frantic in its moves to launch another war on this land together with its American master?
					
					 The Koreans can never escape the holocaust of another war as long as they remain passive onlookers to the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges, the Lee group, to escalate confrontation with the DPRK and unleash a war.

articles.title: Koreans in China Pledge to Settle Accounts with Japan
articles.content:
Koreans in China Pledge to Settle Accounts with Japan 
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China on June 29 made public a statement titled "We will force the Japanese reactionaries, sworn enemy of the Korean people, to pay thousand-fold price for their monstrous atrocities". 
					 The statement said the Japanese imperialists put Korea under their control for more than four decades and enforced brutal colonial rule unprecedented in human history. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists murdered Korean Queen Min and tried to exterminate language and alphabets of the Korean nation and even surnames of its people. They mercilessly killed at least one million innocent Koreans, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 They forcefully hurled about 8.4 million Koreans whom they took to Japan into battlefields and labor sites and took 200,000 Korean women away as comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army to commit crimes against humanity which would make even animals blush.
					
					 They unhesitatingly plundered and destroyed a lot of cultural artifact and natural resources of Korea. 
					
					 After the defeat, the Japanese reactionaries joined the War of aggression on Korea, gaining an ill-fame as a war servant of the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 Even now Japan is actively joining the U.S. anachronistic moves to stifle the DPRK as a war servant of the U.S. and going reckless to realize its ambition for reinvasion without making any apology and reparation for its inhumane crimes against the Korean people. 
					
					 Officials of the General Association of Koreans in China and all other Koreans in China will never pardon the monstrous atrocities of the Japanese imperialists but force them to pay dearly for them.

articles.title: Koreans in China Denounce U.S., S. Korea for Provocations to DPRK
articles.content:
Koreans in China Denounce U.S., S. Korea for Provocations to DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Koreans in China recently made public statements in denunciation of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers' reckless provocations to the DPRK. 
					 The Federation of Young Koreans in China in a statement accused the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea of staging together with the Lee Myung Bak bellicose group of south Korea the largest-ever joint live-shell firing drill targeting the DPRK flag in the area south of the demilitarized zone. 
					
					 Their reckless military actions before June 25 when the Korean War broke out fully disclosed the sinister intention of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers to repeat the tragic event that took place 62 years ago, it said. 
					
					 The Liaoning regional association of the General Association of Koreans in China in its statement on the same day said that the joint drill proved that the U.S. claim it has no hostile intent on the DPRK and its commitment in the February 29 DPRK-U.S. agreement that it would not antagonize the DPRK were whopping lies. 
					
					 The Shenyang City branch of the general association branded the drill as an unpardonable politically-motivated military provocation. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the secretary general of the general association in his statement said that the association and all Koreans in China would fully equip themselves with great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and remain single-mindedly true to the Songun leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un no matter what huge enemy may attack and no matter what storm and stress may threaten them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Peruvian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Peruvian Paper
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The gist of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Correctly Understanding the Originality of Kimilsungism" was carried by the June issue of the Peruvian paper Accion Nacionalista.
					 The work, published on October 2, 1976, clarifies that Kimilsungism is an integral whole of ideology, theory and method of Juche, an original idea whose contents and structure are hard to interpret within the framework of Marxism-Leninism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Iranian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Iranian Paper
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" was carried by the Iranian paper Iran News on July 4.
					 The work, issued on April 20, 2012, deals with the revolutionary exploits Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in their lifetime.
					
					 It also clarifies the tasks for firmly safeguarding and glorifying their idea and feats for all ages.
					
					 The paper carried a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries between June 27 and 30 in commemoration of the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included remembrance meetings in Switzerland and Nigeria, a seminar in Democratic Congo and a lecture in Guinea.
					
					 The chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee said the President was a great leader highly respected by the Korean people and the world progressive people.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il made sure that the President was held in high esteem as the eternal President of the DPRK and turned the DPRK into an invincible military power by pursuing Songun politics, he noted, adding Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, is the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for Memory to President Kim Il Sung said the President was, indeed, the most prominent statesman in the 20th century.
					
					 Under the deep interests and energetic leadership of the President the non-aligned movement has expanded and strengthened to powerful independent forces against imperialism, he said, adding the President was, indeed, a genuine friend and great benefactor of the developing countries.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo elaborated on how the President thoroughly applied the Juche idea to revolution and construction.
					
					 The chief of the Guinean Group for the Study of Kimjongilism said the President found himself among the people all his life going unreserved and sharing destiny with them.
					
					 So the Korean people are still holding him as their eternal leader and father though long time has passed since his demise, the chief added.
					
					 A message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at an event in Switzerland.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by British Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on July 2 to mark the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The statement praised the President as an outstanding genius of revolution.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 He liberated Korea from the colonial rule of Japanese imperialism, established a dignified independent state and a socialist country and worked heart and soul for global independence.
					
					 He put forth reasonable proposals for reunification for putting an end to the national division enforced by outside forces and realizing independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 He foiled all sorts of hostile forces' moves to stifle socialist Korea.
					
					 Indeed, the President was the greatest man.
					
					 Witnessing colorful events in commemoration of the centenary of birth of the President in various parts of the world, we cherished more deeply the boundless reverence for the President.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President is being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Members of Int'l Body Lay Floral Basket before Portrait of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Members of Int'l Body Lay Floral Basket before Portrait of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was placed before a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung with due ceremony on July 6 by the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his demise.
					 Present there were Secretary General Alfonso Fraga Perez and staff members of the organization and Ambassador Jon Yong Jin and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Havana.
					
					 The participants placed a floral basket before the portrait before paying tribute to the President.

articles.title: Feats of Kim Il Sung in Korea's Reunification Movement Lauded
articles.content:
Feats of Kim Il Sung in Korea's Reunification Movement Lauded
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Seminars on feats President          Kim Il Sung performed in the struggle for national reunification were held in Guinea and India on July 2 to mark the 40th anniversary of the July 4 joint statement.
					 Displayed in the venues were books and photos introducing feats of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the national reunification movement.
					
					 Abdoulaye Diallo, chairman of Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, noted that the three principles -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity -- became the great programme for Korea's reunification as they were clearly specified in the July 4 joint statement published by the north and the south of Korea in 1972.
					
					 He noted that the President advanced the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo in October 1980 and published the 10-point Programme for the Great Unity of the Whole Nation in April 1993.
					
					 Recalling that he signed a historic document related to the issue of national reunification on the evening of July 7, a day before he passed away, the chairman said that the exploits of the President for national reunification would always be remembered by the Korean people.
					
					 Anita Chopra, president of the Indian Working Women Society for Study of the Juche Philosophy, said that the President set forth the Three Principles of National Reunification -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					
					 She noted that leader Kim Jong Il formulated the 10-point Programme for the Great Unity of the Whole Nation, the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the Three Principles of National Reunification as the Three Charters for National Reunification true to the intention of the President and wisely led the struggle to materialize them.
					
					 In the meantime, Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Demark-DPRK Friendship Association, and Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland－Korea Society, released statements on July 3 on the same occasion.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Laud Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Career
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Laud Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Career 
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on President Kim Il Sung on the 18th anniversary of his demise.
					 The Lao paper Congtap Pasason Lao on July 3 carried an article titled "DPRK, carrying forward cause of socialism" with a photo of the President among children.
					
					 The article said that the President laid an eternal foundation for socialism while leading the Korean revolution for a long period, adding that he is, indeed, a father of socialist Korea.
					
					 Noting that socialism in the DPRK was successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the article elaborated on his life-long devotion to the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 It noted that Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army  Kim Jong Un stands in the van of revolution of Korea, adding that under his leadership the Korean people would carry to completion the cause of socialism generation after generation.
					
					 The Nepali paper Charcha on July 2 carried an article captioned "Political idea of President Kim Il Sung" accompanied with a photo of him authoring reminiscences.
					
					 A paper of Myanmar on June 30 devoted two whole pages to a special write-up on the revolutionary career of the peerlessly great man who dedicated his life to the well-being of the people. The article was illustrated with a portrait of smiling President and photos of his revolutionary activities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre museo de victoria en guerra coreana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre museo de victoria en guerra coreana
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea recorrio el dia 8 el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					El museo consta de mas de 80 salas de exhibicion donde estan numerosas reliquias historicas revolucionarias  y objetos.
					
					El Comandante Supremo recorrio las salas del periodo de lucha armada antijaponesa, de la revolucion democratica, de la operacion, del tipo de ejercito y especialidad militar, de la victoria, del cuerpo de voluntarios del pueblo chino, del apoyo y ayuda internacionales, de las armas benemeritas, de las armas apoderadas, del panorama de operacion de liberacion de Taejon, etc.
					
					Vio con emocion los datos referentes a las inmortales hazanas revolucionarias del Presidente Kim Il Sung, quien condujo a la victoria la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, la infinita fidelidad al partido y al lider, el heroismo masivo y nobles rasgos espirituales y morales del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea manifestados en la lucha por materializar las orientaciones estrategico-tacticas y ordenes presentadas por el Presidente.
					
					Al recorrer las reliquias y datos historicos exhibidos, senalo que bajo la sabia direccion del Presidente nuestro ejercito y pueblo lograron la victoria brillante venciendo a los invasores  armados de 16 paises con EE.UU. a la cabeza y los titeres surcoreanos en la guerra coreana, lo cual es el milagro de la historia.
					
					Lo que volvio a sentir recorriendo el museo  es que la joven RPDC vencio al imperialismo yanqui que se jactaba de la supremacia en el mundo y sus fuerzas satelites, lo cual se debe a que teniamos la gran idea, la destacada estrategia y tactica y el invencible espiritu de lucha, enfatizo. 
					
					Se puede decir en una palabra que la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria es la de superioridad ideologica, estrategico-tactica y espiritual, subrayo.
					
					Al realizar imborrables meritos y lograr gran victoria en esa guerra bajo la direccion del Partido y el lider, nuestro ejercito y pueblo se hicieron los heroicos que vencieron por primera vez en el mundo a los agresores imperialistas norteamericanos, apunto y agrego que las generaciones venideras deben continuar de modo brillante las hazanas y el espiritu de lucha de sus antecesores.
					
					Dijo que el Museo Conmemorativo es magnifico centro de educacion que permite a los uniformados del EPC, trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes aprender la idea Juche, la idea revolucionaria antiimperialista, el extraordinario arte de mando, la estrategia y tacticas militares y los metodos de combate del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Resalto la necesidad de mejorar la administracion y gestion del museo segun los requerimientos del nuevo siglo.
					
					Recalco que deben impulsar con profundidad la busqueda de vestigios y objetos relacionados con la guerra que puedan ser exhibidos en el museo.
					
					Dijo que es necesario utilizar bien el espacio conforme a las caracteristicas del museo y mejorar incesantemente el esquema, el contenido, la forma y el metodo de exhibicion.
					
					Este museo no fue remozado casi desde que fue construido en 1974, senalo y destaco la importancia de modernizarlo conforme a la epoca del Songun.
					
					El EPC debe asumir la tarea de reconstruccion, indico y expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y los guias del museo cumpliran con su honrosa mision.

articles.title: Cuadros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung por dia de su deceso
articles.content:
Cuadros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung por dia de su deceso
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 18o aniversario del fallecimiento del Presidente   Kim Il Sung, Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado, el presidente de partido amigo y los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las organizaciones de masas, los ministerios y los organos centrales rindieron el dia 8 el homenaje postumo al Presidente Kim Il Sung en el Palacio del Sol de Kumsusan.
					Al pie de las estatuas de pie del Presidente      Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, estaba colocado un cesto de flores a nombre de Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Ademas se veia el otro cesto a nombre del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					Fue depositado ante las estatuas el cesto de flores en nombre comun del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central, del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el CDN de la RPDC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC.
					
					Los participantes rindieron sublime homenaje al Presidente.

articles.title: Kim Pyong Ho aboga por objetividad, imparcialidad y exactitud de prensa
articles.content:
Kim Pyong Ho aboga por objetividad, imparcialidad y exactitud de prensa
  Moscu, 7 de julio (ACNC) -- En su discurso pronunciado en la II Cumbre Mundial de Medios, el director general de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea Kim Pyong Ho insistio en que para cumplir la prensa su mision de conductor y organizador de la opinion publica, debe mantener estrictamente la objetividad, la imparcialidad y la exactitud sin tener prejuicio.
					   Solo cuando los medios masivos de prensa desarrollen las imparciales y objetivas actividades verbales con la posicion de buena vecindad sin recurrir al prejuicio y la tergiversacion, se  puede crear el ambiente de confianza y contribuir a establecer el imparcial sistema internacional de informacion, subrayo.
					
					   Pero, la politica monopolista de unos medios multinacionales, existente todavia en el dominio de palabra, impide lo que se reflejen correctamente las voces de los medios nacionales, recordo.
					
					   Para cumplir sus misiones los medios nacionales, deben intensificar aun mas las cooperaciones entre ellos para apoyarse no en las desinformaciones  injustas de  los medios multinacionales sino en las informaciones de si mismos.
					
					   Aunque en el ano pasado, el ejercito y el pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea sufrieron inesperadamente el gran duelo nacional por el deceso del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, avanzan energicamente hacia la victoria final con cierta conviccion bajo la direccion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, senalo y prosiguio que numerosos periodistas del mundo de visita a la RPDC hayan presenciado tal realidad.
					
					   Enfatizo que la ACNC realiza las actividades de informacion imparcial y objetiva de acuerdo con el ideal de la independencia, la amistad y la paz y se esfuerza activamente por intensificar la cooperacion y el intercambio entre los medios de prensa.
					
					    Expreso esperanza en que todos los medios de prensa informaran exacta e imparcialmente los eventos  que ocurren en la RPDC y el resto del mundo.

articles.title: Luchadores coreanos brillan en campeonato asiatico 2012
articles.content:
Luchadores coreanos brillan en campeonato asiatico 2012
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- En el Campeonato Asiatico de Lucha de Juniores 2012, efectuado en Kirguizistan, los luchadores coreanos lograron buenos exitos.
					Kim Han Song gano medalla de oro en la categoria de 42kg de lucha libre.
					
					Realizaron igual hazana las luchadoras Kim Hyon Gyong y Jong In Sun en las divisiones de 43kg y 52kg, respectivamente.
					
					Ri Jin Ok termino segunda en el peso de 49kg.
					
					Kim Pyong Ju ocupo tercer lugar en la categoria de 50kg de lucha libre (m) y Son Kwon Hui y Ryang Sun Gyong conquistaron tambien preseas de bronce en el peso de 42 kg del estilo grecorromano y la division de 46kg.
